subject: Proper use of TestReult
msgSnippet: Hi, I ve created a test for which I want to return more than one assertion failure. It looks to me like the only thing that will allow me to do this cleanly is
messageBody:
Hi,

I've created a test for which I want to return more than one assertion
failure. It looks to me like the only thing that will allow me to do this
cleanly is TestResult. So this is the outline of my method. Problem is, I'm
not sure what I'm supposed to do with the TestResult. I'm not even sure that
this is the right way to do this. It gives the spirit of what I want, though.

Is this the right way to affect the test results? If not, how should I be
doing it?

Thanks,

L

public void testMissingMandatoryFields() {
HashMap data = new HashMap();
Iterator iter;
TestResult result = this.createTestResult();

data.put(Data.CITY, Data.CITY);
data.put(Data.COUNTRY, "Foo");
data.put(Data.NAME, Data.WNO_NAME);
data.put(Data.STATE, "BR");
data.put(Data.POSTAL_CODE, "H0H0H0");
data.put(Data.PRIMARY_ADDRESS,Data.PRIMARY_ADDRESS);

iter = data.keySet().iterator();

while (iter.hasNext()) {
Object oldKey = iter.next();
Object oldValue = data.get(oldKey);
Data wpd= null;
Profile profile;

data.remove(oldKey);
wpd = new Data((String) data.get(Data.NAME),
(String) data.get(Data.PRIMARY_ADDRESS),
(String) data.get(Data.CITY),
(String) data.get(Data.STATE),
(String) data.get(Data.COUNTRY),
(String) data.get(Data.POSTAL_CODE));

try {
profile = home.create(wpd);
} catch (IllegalFieldsFormatException ie) {
} catch (Exception e) {
result.addError(this, e);
}
}
}

--
